page.title: 06FARMING
page.content: The Cardross farms we visited were mixed farms. At the first farm the family have been farming there for 82 years. Both farms had Friesian and Ayrshire dairy cows. The first farm milked their cows at 08:30,and the second farm milked their cows at 04:00.The smaller farm is 250 acres and the cows produce 156 gallons of milk per day. The milk is collected by the Scottish Milk Marketing Board tanker and taken to Millerston in Glasgow. The main crops grown are hay and barley:hay is harvested in June and barley in August. Both farms also keep beef cattle, 70% of which are slaughtered and the remaining 30% sold at markets either in Stirling or Paisley. Both farms also kept sheep, one having a flock of 500. The sheep are sheared in June.Summer is the busiest time of the year.
